verb.description: Try to find something by looking or otherwise seeking carefully and thoroughly.
examples: I searched among the rocks, but there was nothing
Daniel is then able to search out the most advantageous mortgage
Hugh will be searching for the truth

noun.description: An act of searching for someone or something.
examples: the police carried out a thorough search of the premises
he plans to go to the Himalayas in search of a yeti

origin: Middle English: from Old French cerchier (verb), from late Latin circare go round, from Latin circus circle.
